sen.j: ワカメ（若布、和布、稚海藻、裙蔕菜、学名：Undaria pinnatifida）は、褐藻コンブ目チガイソ科の海藻。
sen.e: Seaweed (written as 若布, 和布, 稚海藻, or 裙蔕菜 in kanji, scientific name: Undaria pinnatifida) is one of marine alga of Class Phaeophyceae, Order Laminariales, Family Alariaceae.
Seaweed (written as 若布, 和布, 稚海藻, or 裙蔕菜 in kanji; scientific name: Undaria pinnatifida) is a marine alga of the class Phaeophyceae, order Laminariales and family Alariaceae.
Seaweed (written as 若布, 和布, 稚海藻, or 裙蔕菜 in kanji; scientific name: Undaria pinnatifida) is a marine alga of the class Phaeophyceae, order Laminariales and family Alariaceae.

sen.j: 日本海側では北海道以南、太平洋岸では北海道南西部から九州にかけての海岸で、低潮線付近から下に生育する。
sen.e: It grows in south of Hokkaido on the Sea of Japan side, southwest of Hokkaido to Kyushu on Pacific Ocean coastline, and around and below the low-tide line.
It grows south of Hokkaido on the Sea of Japan side, southwest of Hokkaido to Kyushu along the Pacific coastline, and around and below the low-tide line.
It grows south of Hokkaido on the Sea of Japan side, southwest of Hokkaido to Kyushu along the Pacific coastline, and around and below the low-tide line.

sen.j: 根状の部分で岩などに固着し、葉状部を水中に伸ばし、長さは2mにも達する。
sen.e: The root-shaped part adheres to rocks, phylloid part extends in the water, and its length reaches two meters.
The root-shaped part adheres to rocks while the phylloid part extends into the water, and its length reaches two meters.
The root-shaped part adheres to rocks while the phylloid part extends into the water, and its length reaches two meters.

sen.j: 葉状部の中心には主軸があって、それを中心に左右に広く伸び、大きく羽状に裂ける。
sen.e: There is a main axis in the center of the phylloid part, foliage extends widely to right and left with the main axis in the center, and broadly splits pinnately.
There is a main axis in the center of the phylloid part, and the foliage extends widely to the right and left with the main axis in the center, and then splits broadly in a pinnate manner.
There is a main axis in the center of the phylloid part, and the foliage extends widely to the right and left with the main axis in the center, and then splits broadly in a pinnate manner.

sen.j: 広がった葉の基部には、とても厚くなった葉状部がちぢまり、折れ重なったような部分がある。
sen.e: In the basal portion of the extended foliage, there is a part that looks like thickened phylloid part is shrunk and folded.
In the basal portion of the extended foliage, there is a part that resembles a thickened, shrunken and folded phylloid part.
In the basal portion of the extended foliage, there is a part that resembles a thickened, shrunken and folded phylloid part.

sen.j: これをメカブ（和布蕪）と呼び、生殖細胞が集まっている部分である。
sen.e: This part is called mekabu and is the part where germ cell is gathered.
This part, called the mekabu, and where the germ cells are gathered.
This part, called the mekabu, and where the germ cells are gathered.

sen.j: ワカメは世代交代を行なう。
sen.e: Seaweed undergoes alternation of generations.
Seaweed undergoes the alternation of generations.
Seaweed undergoes the alternation of generations.

sen.j: 一般に知られているワカメは胞子体（複相世代）であり、メカブで作られた遊走子から発芽した配偶体は、ごく小さなものである。
sen.e: Commonly known seaweed is sporophyte (diploid generation), and gametophyte germinated from zoospore, produced in mekabu, is very small.
The commonly known seaweed is sporophyte (diploid generation), and the gametophyte germinated from zoospore, produced in the mekabu, is very small.
The commonly known seaweed is sporophyte (diploid generation), and the gametophyte germinated from zoospore, produced in the mekabu, is very small.

sen.j: 海苔と同じく、古くから日本人に親しまれてきた海藻であり、『万葉集』にも「和海藻（にぎめ）」として百首近く残されている。
sen.e: Seaweed has been familiar to Japanese through the ages as well as laver, nearly one hundred poems were remained in "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) as 'nigime' (Japanese marine alga).

Seaweed has been familiar to Japanese through the ages as well as laver, and in fact nearly 100 poems in "Manyoshu (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves)" contain the word 'nigime (Japanese marine alga).'

Seaweed has been familiar to Japanese through the ages as well as laver, and in fact nearly 100 poems in "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) contain the word 'nigime' (Japanese marine alga).

sen.j: 主に食用として用いられ、酢の物、汁物の具として使われたが、豊作祈願の神事などにも利用されていた。
sen.e: It was mainly for edible use, such as vinegared food and ingredients in soup dishes, but it was also used for Shinto rituals such as pray for good harvest.
It was mainly for edible use, such as vinegared food and ingredients in soup dishes, but it was also used for Shinto rituals such as in praying for a good harvest.
It was mainly for edible use, such as vinegared food and ingredients in soup dishes, but it was also used for Shinto rituals such as in praying for a good harvest.

sen.j: 横浜の「みなとみらい地区」の地先海域では、「夢ワカメ・ワークショップ」という環境教育のプロジェクトを行っており、地元の小学生など総勢三百名で横浜港でワカメを養殖している。
sen.e: In the marine area around 'Minatomirai district,' the project for ecological education called 'Yume wakame workshop' (dream seaweed workshop) is held, and the total of three hundred local elementary students farms seaweed in the port of Yokohama.

In the marine area around the 'Minatomirai district,' the project for ecological education called 'Yume wakame workshop (dream seaweed workshop)' is held, and a total of 300 local elementary students farm seaweed in the port of Yokohama.

In the marine area around the 'Minatomirai district,' the project for ecological education called 'Yume wakame workshop' (dream seaweed workshop) is held, and a total of 300 local elementary students farm seaweed in the port of Yokohama.

sen.j: ワカメは海中のリンや窒素を取り込みながら成長し、海水をきれいにする為、その効果も期待されている。
sen.e: Seaweed grows while ingesting phosphorus and nitrogen undersea and cleans seawater, so the effect is expected.
Seaweed grows while ingesting phosphorus and nitrogen undersea, with the expected benefit of cleaning the seawater.
Seaweed grows while ingesting phosphorus and nitrogen undersea, with the expected benefit of cleaning the seawater.

sen.j: タクシー運転手の間では隠語として「回送」の意（海草にかけて）、もしくは酔っ払いの客の意(揺ら揺ら揺れている事から)で使用される。
sen.e: Among taxi drivers, it is used as the meaning of 'Kaiso' (not in service) (same pronunciation for Kaiso (marine alga)) or drunk customer (since her/she sways like a seaweed) as jargon.
Among taxi drivers, it's used as the meaning of 'Kaiso (not in service)' (with the same pronunciation for Kaiso (marine alga)) or drunken customer (since her/she sways like seaweed) as jargon.
Among taxi drivers, it's used as the meaning of 'Kaiso' (not in service) (with the same pronunciation for Kaiso (marine alga)) or drunken customer (since her/she sways like seaweed) as jargon.

sen.j: また陰毛を表す隠語として用いられる事もある（わかめ酒 (アダルト)）。
sen.e: It is sometimes used as jargon for pubic hair (wakame-zake (poring sake in the inner thighs) (adult)).
It is sometimes used as jargon for pubic hair (wakame-zake (pouring sake in the inner thighs) (adult)).
It is sometimes used as jargon for pubic hair (wakame-zake (pouring sake in the inner thighs) (adult)).

sen.j: 主に塩漬けしたり乾燥させたりして保存性を高めて商品化される。
sen.e: It is commoditized after improving preservative quality mainly by salting or drying.
It is commoditized after its preservative quality is improved, mainly through salting or drying.
It is commoditized after its preservative quality is improved, mainly through salting or drying.

sen.j: 使うときは水に漬け、塩抜きあるいは戻して用いる。
sen.e: When you use it, you should rinse off the salt or soak it in water to reconstitute.
When the seaweed is to be used, it should first be rinsed of its salt or reconstituted by soaking in water.
When the seaweed is to be used, it should first be rinsed of its salt or reconstituted by soaking in water.

sen.j: 市販のワカメは緑色であるが、生きた状態では褐色であり、湯通しすることで緑色となる。
sen.e: Commercial seaweed is green, but live seaweed is brown and turned green when it is blanched.
Commercial seaweed is green, but live seaweed is brown and then turns green when it's blanched.
Commercial seaweed is green, but live seaweed is brown and then turns green when it's blanched.

sen.j: ワカメは味噌汁などの汁物の具としてよく使われる。
sen.e: It is often used as an ingredient in soup dishes, such as miso soup.
It is often used as an ingredient in soup dishes, such as miso soup.
It is often used as an ingredient in soup dishes, such as miso soup.

sen.j: 他にも酢の物、炒め物、サラダ、地域によっては天ぷら等幅広く料理される。
sen.e: Other than that, it is widely used in vinegared food, fried dishes, salad, and tempura in some regions.
Other than that, it's widely used in vinegared food, fried dishes, salads and tempura in some regions.
Other than that, it's widely used in vinegared food, fried dishes, salads and tempura in some regions.

sen.j: 旨み成分を多く含み、また低カロリーであることから、ダイエット食品としても適している。
sen.e: It contains many flavor components and low calories, so it is suitable for diet products.
It contains many flavor components and is low in calories, so it's suitable for diet products.
It contains many flavor components and is low in calories, so it's suitable for diet products.

sen.j: ワカメに多く含まれる栄養素は、食物繊維、アルギン酸、フコイダンなどで、血中コレステロール値を下げたり、動脈硬化や心筋梗塞を防ぐなどの効果があると言われている。
sen.e: The nutritive components in seaweed are dietary fiber, algin acid, and fucoidan, and it is said that they have effects to lower blood-cholesterol levels and prevent cardiac infarction and arterial sclerosis.
The nutritive components in seaweed are dietary fiber, algin acid and fucoidan, and it's said that they serve to lower blood-cholesterol levels and prevent cardiac infarction and arterial sclerosis.
The nutritive components in seaweed are dietary fiber, algin acid and fucoidan, and it's said that they serve to lower blood-cholesterol levels and prevent cardiac infarction and arterial sclerosis.

sen.j: ワカメを食用に供する習慣はほぼ日本と朝鮮半島にしかなく、日本や朝鮮半島と同じく海藻を食べる習慣が一応ある中国ですら食べなかった。
sen.e: The custom to serve seaweed as edible use exists in Japan and Korean Peninsula, but people in China did not eat seaweed even though they had custom to eat marine alga as in Japan and Korean Peninsula.

The custom of serving seaweed as an edible materials existed in Japan and the Korean Peninsula, but people in China did not eat seaweed even though they had the custom of eating marine alga, as in Japan and the Korean Peninsula.

The custom of serving seaweed as an edible materials existed in Japan and the Korean Peninsula, but people in China did not eat seaweed even though they had the custom of eating marine alga, as in Japan and the Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: しかし中国でも近年は日本からの養殖技術の導入により、日本向けの輸出用に養殖されたものが中国国内の市場に出回り、食べられるようになっている。
sen.e: However, by the introduction of aquaculture technology from Japan, cultured seaweed for export to Japan appeared on the market in China, so people started to eat it.
However, with the introduction of aquaculture technology from Japan, cultured seaweed for export to Japan appeared on the market in China, so people started to eat it.
However, with the introduction of aquaculture technology from Japan, cultured seaweed for export to Japan appeared on the market in China, so people started to eat it.

sen.j: 一方で、朝鮮半島ではワカメを日本以上に多食し、韓国国民一人あたりの年間ワカメ平均消費量は、日本の三倍と言われている。
sen.e: On the other hand, seaweed is more widely consumed in Korean Peninsula than Japan, and the mean annual seaweed consumption per capita in Korea is three times higher than that of Japan.
However, seaweed is more widely consumed in the Korean Peninsula than in Japan, and the mean annual seaweed consumption per capita in Korea is three times higher than that of Japan.
However, seaweed is more widely consumed in the Korean Peninsula than in Japan, and the mean annual seaweed consumption per capita in Korea is three times higher than that of Japan.

sen.j: 日本と異なり、韓国では天然ワカメと養殖ワカメに歴然としたブランド格差があり、天然ワカメは非常に貴重視され高値で取引される。
sen.e: Unlike Japan, there is unbridgeable brand gap between natural seaweed and cultured seaweed, and natural seaweed is regarded as very precious and traded at a high price.
Unlike in Japan, there is an unbridgeable brand gap between natural seaweed and cultured seaweed, and natural seaweed is regarded as very precious and traded at a high price.
Unlike in Japan, there is an unbridgeable brand gap between natural seaweed and cultured seaweed, and natural seaweed is regarded as very precious and traded at a high price.

sen.j: 天然ワカメが取れる磯や海域は畑や田と同じ不動産扱いされ、厳しい管理のもとで一族に代々相続される。
sen.e: The rocky shores and marine areas where natural seaweed can be caught are treated as property as well as farms and rice fields and succeeded by the family for generations under the strict control.

The rocky shores and marine areas where natural seaweed can be caught are treated as property, like farms and rice fields; such areas are strictly controlled and have been subject to family succession for generations.

The rocky shores and marine areas where natural seaweed can be caught are treated as property, like farms and rice fields; such areas are strictly controlled and have been subject to family succession for generations.

sen.j: また、韓国では誕生日にワカメのスープを飲む習慣がある。
sen.e: Also, there is a custom that people have seaweed soup on their birthdays in Korea.
Additionally, in Korea there is a custom of having seaweed soup on one's birthday.
Additionally, in Korea there is a custom of having seaweed soup on one's birthday.

sen.j: 高血圧症とワカメ
sen.e: Hypertension and seaweed
Hypertension and seaweed
Hypertension and seaweed

sen.j: ワカメ等の海草類に含まれるアルギン酸は、消化管中で食物中のナトリウムと化合し一部がアルギン酸ナトリウムに変化する。
sen.e: The algin acid contained in marine algae such as seaweed is partially changed to alginate sodium by combining with sodium in the diet in the gastrointestinal tract.
The algin acid contained in marine algae such as seaweed is, when combined with sodium in the diet, partially changed to alginate sodium in the gastrointestinal tract.
The algin acid contained in marine algae such as seaweed is, when combined with sodium in the diet, partially changed to alginate sodium in the gastrointestinal tract.

sen.j: アルギン酸ナトリウムはヒトの腸管内の消化酵素では分解できないため便として排出される。
sen.e: The alginate sodium cannot be dissolved by digestive enzyme in the human intestine, so it is expelled as feces.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The alginate sodium cannot be dissolved by digestive enzyme in the human intestine, so it's expelled in the feces.
The alginate sodium cannot be dissolved by digestive enzyme in the human intestine, so it's expelled in the feces.

sen.j: 結果的に体内へのナトリウム吸収量が抑制されることになる。
sen.e: As a result, absorbed amount of sodium into the body is suppressed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result, the amount of sodium absorbed into the body is limited.
As a result, the amount of sodium absorbed into the body is limited.

sen.j: 侵略的外来種
sen.e: Invasive foreign species
Invasive foreign species

sen.j: ワカメは、世界の侵略的外来種ワースト100 (IUCN, 2000) 選定種の一つである。
sen.e: Seaweed is one of the selected species of the 100 worst invasive foreign species (IUCN, 2000).
Seaweed is one of the selected species of the 100 worst invasive foreign species (IUCN, 2000).
Seaweed is one of the selected species of the 100 worst invasive foreign species (IUCN, 2000).

sen.j: ワカメの遊走子が日本からの商船のバラストタンクの水に混入した状態でニュージーランドやオーストラリア、ヨーロッパ諸国の沿岸域に運ばれる。
sen.e: The zoospore from seaweed are mixed in the ballast tank water on the commercial ship from Japan and carried to the littoral region in New Zealand, Australia, and European counties.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The zoospores from seaweed are mixed in the ballast tank water on commercial ships from Japan and carried to the littoral regions of New Zealand, Australia and European counties.

sen.j: そこで水と共に放出されて増殖しており、外来生物として問題になっている。
sen.e: It is released with the water and grows there, so it is becoming a problem as alien species.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is released with the water and grows there, so it's becoming a problem as an alien species.

sen.j: これらの国々では海藻を常食する食習慣がないこともあり邪魔者扱いされている。
sen.e: There is no dietary habit to eat marine alga in these countries, so it is treated as a nuisance.
